<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>




<DIV style="font-family: Helvetica,Arial,sans-serif">

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; text-indent: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">AirNet&#146;s executive officers will be made in the first quarter of the fiscal year ending December
31, 2008 based upon AirNet&#146;s performance and each executive officer&#146;s performance for the 2007
fiscal year. Mr.&nbsp;Parker&#146;s incentive compensation payments will be made in two installments no
later than July&nbsp;31, 2007 and March&nbsp;15, 2008. In order to receive a payment, a participant must be
actively employed by AirNet at the time the payment is made. New employees who qualify for the
2007 Incentive Compensation Plan will be eligible to participate on the first day of the calendar
quarter following their date of hire.</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">In the event the incentive compensation payments otherwise available for payment under the 2007
Incentive Plan based upon AirNet&#146;s level of pre-tax income are
not to be paid to certain participants
as a result of such participants&#146; failure to attain their personal goals or AirNet&#146;s failure to
attain the predetermined levels of Express Services revenues or contribution margin, such unpaid
amounts may be awarded at the discretion of the Compensation Committee to participants in the 2007
Incentive Plan or to other employees of AirNet not participating in the 2007 Incentive Plan. In
the event such discretionary awards are made to any participant, including AirNet&#146;s executive
officers, the total incentive compensation payment to any such participant may exceed the targeted
incentive compensation payment to such participant as described above.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">The Compensation Committee may amend, modify or terminate the 2007 Incentive Plan at any time.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>Calling of 2007 Annual Meeting of Shareholders</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">At a meeting held on March&nbsp;28, 2007, the AirNet Board of Directors adopted resolutions calling for
the 2007 Annual Meeting of Shareholders of AirNet Systems, Inc. to be held on June&nbsp;6, 2007, at 10
a.m., Eastern Daylight Saving Time, at The Courtyard by Marriott Columbus Airport, 2901 Airport
Drive, Columbus, Ohio 43219. The AirNet Board of Directors fixed April&nbsp;27, 2007 as the record date
for the determination of the shareholders of AirNet entitled to receive notice of, and to vote at,
the 2007 Annual Meeting of Shareholders. AirNet shareholders seeking to bring business before the 2007 Annual Meeting of Shareholders, or to
nominate candidates for election as directors at the 2007 Annual Meeting of Shareholders, must provide
notice thereof in writing to AirNet, which notice must be received no
later than April 7, 2007.  The AirNet
Code of Regulations specifies certain requirements for a shareholder&#146;s notice to be in proper written form.
In addition, shareholder proposals must be in the form specified in SEC Rule 14a-8.  Shareholder proposals
and notices must be addressed to the Secretary of AirNet at its executive offices located at 7250 Star Check
Drive, Columbus, Ohio  43217.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left">
<A name="117"></A>
</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt"><B>PART III</B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left">
<A name="118"></A>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>ITEM 10 &#151; DIRECTORS, EXECUTIVE OFFICERS AND CORPORATE GOVERNANCE</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">The
information required by this Item&nbsp;10, other than the information
set forth below, is incorporated herein by reference from the definitive
Proxy Statement of AirNet Systems, Inc. for the Annual Meeting of Shareholders to be held on June
6, 2007, which definitive Proxy Statement will be filed subsequent to the filing of this Annual
Report on Form 10-K and not later than 120&nbsp;days after December&nbsp;31, 2006.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><B>Corporate Governance Documents</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">AirNet&#146;s Board of Directors has adopted charters for each of the Audit Committee, the Compensation Committee and the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee as well as Corporate Governance Guidelines.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">In addition, the AirNet Board of Directors has adopted a Code of Business Conduct and Ethics covering the
directors, officers and employees (team members) of AirNet and its subsidiaries, including AirNet&#146;s
Chairman of the Board, Chief Executive Officer and President (the principal executive officer), AirNet&#146;s Chief
Financial Officer, Treasurer and Secretary (the principal financial officer) and AirNet&#146;s Vice President of
Finance, Controller and Principal Accounting Officer (the principal accounting officer).  AirNet intends to
disclose the following in a current report on Form 8-K within the required four business days following their
occurrence:  (A) the date and nature of any amendment to a provision of AirNet&#146;s Code of Business Conduct
and Ethics that (i) applies to AirNet&#146;s principal executive officer, principal financial officer, principal
accounting officer or controller, or persons performing similar functions, (ii) relates to any element of the
code of ethics definition enumerated in Item 406(b) of SEC Regulation S-K, and (iii) is not a technical,
administrative or other non-substantive amendment; and (B) a description of any waiver (including the
nature of the waiver, the name of the person to whom the waiver was granted and the date of the waiver),
including an implicit waiver, from a provision of the Code of Business Conduct and Ethics granted to AirNet&#146;s
principal executive officer, principal financial officer, principal accounting officer or controller, or persons
performing similar functions that relates to one or more of the elements of the code of ethics definition set
forth in Item 406(b) of SEC Regulation S-K.  In addition, AirNet will disclose any waivers from the provisions
of the Code of Business Conduct and Ethics granted to a director or executive officer of AirNet in a current
report on Form 8-K within four business days following their occurrence.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">
The text of each of the Audit Committee Charter, the Compensation Committee Charter, the Nominating and
Corporate Governance Committee Charter, the Corporate Governance Guidelines and the Code of
Business Conduct and Ethics is posted under the &#147;Corporate Governance&#148; link on the &#147;Investor Relations&#148;
page of AirNet&#146;s Internet website located at www.AirNet.com.  Interested persons may also obtain copies of
the Audit Committee Charter, the Compensation Committee Charter, the Nominating and Corporate
Governance Committee Charter, the Corporate Governance Guidelines and the Code of Business Conduct
and Ethics, without charge, by writing to the Chief Financial Officer, Treasurer and Secretary of AirNet at
AirNet Systems, Inc., 7250 Star Check Drive, Columbus, Ohio 43217, Attention:  Gary W. Qualmann.  In
addition, AirNet&#146;s Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, as revised on August 2, 2006, is incorporated by
reference in Exhibit 14 to this Annual Report on Form 10-K from Exhibit 14 to AirNet&#146;s Quarterly Report on
Form 10-Q for the quarterly period ended June 30, 2006.</DIV>

Inc., AirNet Management, Inc., Mercury

supplementally any omitted schedule or

    <TD align="left" valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
    <TD align="right" valign="top"><DIV style="margin-left:0px; text-indent:-0px">14
</DIV></TD>

Ethics, as revised on August 2, 2006
</TD>

by reference from

for the quarterly

<DOCUMENT>
<TYPE>EX-4.50
<SEQUENCE>2
<FILENAME>l25426aexv4w50.htm
<DESCRIPTION>EX-4.50

<HTML>
<HEAD>
<TITLE>EX-4.50</TITLE>
</HEAD>
<BODY bgcolor="#FFFFFF">
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>
<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">


<DIV align="right" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>EXHIBIT 4.50</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt"><B>SECOND AMENDED AND RESTATED CREDIT AGREEMENT</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This Second Amended and Restated Credit Agreement, dated as of March&nbsp;29, 2007, is among AirNet
Systems, Inc., an Ohio corporation, The Huntington National Bank, a national banking association,
in its capacity as Administrative Agent for the Lender hereunder, and The Huntington National Bank,
a national banking association, as the Lender hereunder. The parties hereto agree as follows:
</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt"><B>ARTICLE I</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><U><B>Definitions</B></U>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section&nbsp;1.1. <U>Definitions</U>. As used in this Agreement:
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Account Debtor</I></U>&#148; shall have the meaning set forth in the definition of Eligible
Accounts Receivable.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Accounts Receivable</I></U>&#148; shall mean, at any date, the total of all accounts which would
be properly classified in accordance with Agreement Accounting Principles as accounts receivable on
the consolidated balance sheet of the Borrower and its Subsidiaries at such date.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Acquisition</I></U>&#148; means any transaction, or any series of related transactions,
consummated on or after the date of this Agreement, by which the Borrower or any of its
Subsidiaries (i)&nbsp;acquires any going business or all or substantially all of the assets of any firm,
corporation or limited liability company, or division thereof, whether through purchase of assets,
merger or otherwise or (ii)&nbsp;directly or indirectly acquires (in one transaction or as the most
recent transaction in a series of transactions) at least a majority (in number of votes) of the
securities of a corporation which have ordinary voting power for the election of directors (other
than securities having such power only by reason of the happening of a contingency) or a majority
(by percentage or voting power) of the outstanding ownership interests of a partnership or limited
liability company.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Administrative Agent</I></U>&#148; and &#147;<U><I>Agent</I></U>&#148; means The Huntington National Bank, in its
capacity as contractual representative of the Lender pursuant to Article&nbsp;XIII, and not in its
individual capacity as Lender, and any successor Administrative Agent appointed pursuant to Article
XIII.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Advance</I></U>&#148; means a borrowing hereunder (i)&nbsp;made by Lender, or (ii)&nbsp;converted or
continued by Lender, consisting, in either case, of the aggregate amount of the several Loans of
the same Type and, in the case of Eurodollar Loans, for the same Interest Period.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Affiliate</I></U>&#148; of any Person means any other Person directly or indirectly controlling,
controlled by or under common control with such Person. A Person shall be deemed to control
another Person if the controlling Person owns 20% or more of any class of voting securities (or
other ownership interests) of the controlled Person or possesses, directly or indirectly, the power
to direct or cause the direction of the management or policies of the controlled Person, whether
through ownership of stock or other ownership interests, by contract or otherwise.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Agreement</I></U>&#148; means this Second Amended and Restated Credit Agreement, as it may be
amended, modified, supplemented, extended, restated or replaced from time to time.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Agreement Accounting Principles</I></U>&#148; means generally accepted accounting principles as in
effect from time to time, applied in a manner consistent with that used in preparing the financial
statements referred to in Section&nbsp;5.4.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Alternative Base Rate</I></U>&#148; means the rate of interest equal to the higher of (i)&nbsp;the
Prime Rate, or (ii)&nbsp;the sum of (y)&nbsp;the Federal Funds Effective Rate, and (z)&nbsp;one half of one
percent (.5%).
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>AMI</I></U>&#148; means AirNet Management, Inc., an Ohio corporation.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Amendment and Restatement Fee</I></U>&#148; shall be as defined in Section&nbsp;2.21.
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Applicable Fee Rate</I></U>&#148; means, at any time, the percentage rate per annum at which
commitment fees and LC Fees are accruing on the unused portion of the Revolving Commitment or
undrawn stated amount under the relevant Facility LC, as applicable, at such time as set forth in
the Pricing Schedule.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Applicable Margin</I></U>&#148; means, with respect to Advances of any Type at any time, the
percentage rate per annum which is applicable at such time with respect to Advances of such Type as
set forth in the Pricing Schedule.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Article</I></U>&#148; means an article of this Agreement unless another document is specifically
referenced.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Assignment Agreement</I></U>&#148; means that certain Assignment Agreement by and between Lender
and JPM (defined below in the definition for the term &#147;Note&#148;), as Assignee and Assignor,
respectively
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Authorized Officer</I></U>&#148; means any of the Chief Executive Officer, Chief Financial Officer
or Controller of the Borrower, acting singly.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Available Revolving Commitment</I></U>&#148; means, at any time, the Revolving Commitment then in
effect minus the Outstanding Credit Exposure at such time.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Board</I></U>&#148; means the Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System of the United
States of America.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Book Value</I></U>&#148; means the value at which an asset is carried on the balance sheet of
Borrower at any particular date.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Borrower</I></U>&#148; means AirNet Systems, Inc., an Ohio corporation, and its successors and
assigns.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Borrowing Base</I></U>&#148; means, at any date, that amount which is equal to the lesser of (a)
Fifteen Million Dollars ($15,000,000.00), (b)&nbsp;the Revolving Commitment, or (c)&nbsp;the aggregate of (i)
80% of the Eligible Accounts Receivable of the Borrower and its Subsidiaries on a consolidated
basis as of such date, and (ii)&nbsp;50% of the Eligible Inventory of the Borrower and its Subsidiaries
on a consolidated basis as of such date.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Borrowing Base Certificate</I></U>&#148; means the certificate substantially similar in form and
substance to that shown on Exhibit&nbsp;C, which shall contain all supporting documentation, including
accounts receivable and aging schedules.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Borrowing Date</I></U>&#148; means a date on which an Advance is made hereunder as determined
pursuant to Section&nbsp;2.6.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Borrowing Notice</I></U>&#148; shall have the meaning set forth in Section&nbsp;2.6.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Business Day</I></U>&#148; means (i)&nbsp;with respect to any borrowing, payment or rate selection of
Eurodollar Advances, a day (other than a Saturday or Sunday) on which banks generally are open in
Columbus, Ohio and New York, New York for the conduct of substantially all of their commercial
lending activities, interbank wire transfers can be made on the Fedwire system, and dealings in
United States dollars are carried on in the London interbank market, and (ii)&nbsp;for all other
purposes, a day (other than a Saturday or Sunday) on which banks generally are open in Columbus,
Ohio for the conduct of substantially all of their commercial lending activities and interbank wire
transfers can be made on the Fedwire system.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Capital Expenditures</I></U>&#148; means, without duplication, any expenditures for any purchase
or other acquisition of any asset which would be classified as a fixed or capital asset on a
consolidated balance sheet of the Borrower and its Subsidiaries prepared in accordance with
Agreement Accounting Principles, except (i)&nbsp;expenditures for the purchase of aircraft held for
resale within 90&nbsp;days, and (ii)&nbsp;expenditures of insurance proceeds for the replacement of any asset
with respect to which such insurance proceeds were paid to Borrower or any Subsidiary as a result
of any loss or damage to such asset.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Capitalized Lease</I></U>&#148; of a Person means any lease of Property by such Person as lessee
which would be capitalized on a balance sheet of such Person prepared in accordance with Agreement
Accounting Principles.
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Capitalized Lease Obligations</I></U>&#148; of a Person means the amount of the obligations of
such Person under Capitalized Leases which would be shown as a liability on a balance sheet of such
Person prepared in accordance with Agreement Accounting Principles.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Charges</I></U>&#148; shall have the meaning set forth in Section&nbsp;12.20.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Cash Equivalent Investments</I></U>&#148; means (i)&nbsp;short-term obligations of, or fully guaranteed
by, the United States of America, (ii)&nbsp;commercial paper rated A-1 or better by S&#038;P or P-1 or better
by Moody&#146;s, (iii)&nbsp;demand deposit accounts maintained in the ordinary course of business, (iv)
certificates of deposit issued by and time deposits with any commercial banks (whether domestic or
foreign) having capital and surplus in excess of $100,000,000, and (v)&nbsp;money market accounts;
<I>provided </I>in each case that the same provides for payment of both principal and interest (and not
principal alone or interest alone) and is not subject to any contingency regarding the payment of
principal or interest. It is understood and agreed that all sums deposited by Borrower in accounts
held by Lender and invested by Lender shall constitute Cash Equivalent Investments.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Change in Control</I></U>&#148; means, with respect to Borrower, an event or series of events by
which:
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(i)&nbsp;any &#147;person&#148; or &#147;group&#148; (within the meaning of Section 13(d) and 14(d) of the Securities
Exchange Act of 1934) has become the &#147;beneficial owner&#148; (as defined in Rules&nbsp;13d-3 and 13d-5 under
the Exchange Act, except that a Person shall be deemed to have &#147;beneficial ownership&#148; of all
securities that any such Person has the right to acquire, whether such right is exercisable
immediately or only after the passage of time), by way of merger, consolidation or otherwise, of
30% or more of the equity interests of Borrower on a fully-diluted basis after giving effect to the
conversion and exercise of all outstanding equity equivalents (whether such equity equivalents are
then currently convertible or exercisable); or
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(ii)&nbsp;during any period of 12 consecutive months, a majority of the members of the board of
directors or other equivalent governing body of Borrower cease to be composed of individuals (A)
who were members of that board or equivalent governing body on the first day of such period, (B)
whose election or nomination to that board or equivalent governing body was approved by individuals
referred to in clause (ii)(A) above constituting at the time of such election or nomination at
least a majority of that board or equivalent governing body or (C)&nbsp;whose election or nomination to
that board or other governing body was approved by individuals referred to in clauses (ii)(A) and
(B)&nbsp;above constituting at the time of such election or nomination at least a majority of that board
or equivalent governing body; provided that Lender determines that, for purposes of this Agreement,
any such event or series of events described in this subpart (ii)&nbsp;shall constitute a Change in
Control.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Closing Agenda</I></U>&#148; means the Closing Agenda prepared by Lender&#146;s counsel setting forth
the required closing documentation and other items pursuant to Section&nbsp;4.1, as the same may be
amended or modified from time to time.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Closing Date</I></U>&#148; means the date on which this Agreement is fully executed.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Code</I></U>&#148; means the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended, reformed or otherwise
modified from time to time.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Consolidated Capital Expenditures</I></U>&#148; means, with reference to any period, the Capital
Expenditures of the Borrower and its Subsidiaries calculated on a consolidated basis for such
period.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Consolidated Dividends</I></U>&#148; means, with reference to any period, any dividends or
distributions on the membership interests, capital stock or other equity interests of Borrower or
any of its Subsidiaries (other than dividends payable in its own membership interests, capital
stock or other equity interests) or the redemption, repurchase or other acquisition or retirement
of any of the membership interests, capital stock or other equity interests of Borrower or any of
its Subsidiaries at any time outstanding, all calculated on a consolidated basis for such period,
except for dividends or distributions made by any Subsidiary to the Borrower.
</DIV>



<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Consolidated EBITDA</I></U>&#148; means with respect to any period, Consolidated Net Income <I>plus</I>, to
the extent deducted from revenues in determining Consolidated Net Income, (i)&nbsp;Consolidated Interest
Expense, (ii)&nbsp;Consolidated Income Tax Expense, (iii)&nbsp;depreciation, calculated for the Borrower and
its Subsidiaries on a consolidated basis, (iv)&nbsp;amortization, calculated for the Borrower and its
Subsidiaries on a consolidated basis; (v)&nbsp;for the fiscal quarter ending September&nbsp;30, 2006 only, an
amount equal to $24,560,000.00 (which reflects the non-cash impairment charge recognized by
Borrower in the fiscal quarter ending September&nbsp;30, 2006), and (vi)&nbsp;extraordinary losses
(determined in accordance with Agreement Accounting Principles) incurred other than in the ordinary
course of business, calculated for the Borrower and its Subsidiaries on a consolidated basis,
<I>minus, </I>to the extent included in Consolidated Net Income, extraordinary gains (determined in
accordance with Agreement Accounting Principles) realized other than in the ordinary course of
business, calculated for the Borrower and its Subsidiaries on a consolidated basis.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Consolidated Funded Indebtedness</I></U>&#148; means at any time (a)&nbsp;the aggregate dollar amount
of Indebtedness of the Borrower and its Subsidiaries which has actually been funded and is
outstanding, whether or not such amount is due or payable at such time, and (b)&nbsp;all reimbursement
obligations under outstanding Letters of Credit which (i)&nbsp;may be presented, or (ii)&nbsp;have been
presented and have not yet been paid; all calculated for the Borrower and its Subsidiaries on a
consolidated basis as of such time.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Consolidated Income Tax Expense</I></U>&#148; means, for any period, the tax expense of Borrower
and its Subsidiaries on a consolidated basis for said period.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Consolidated Indebtedness</I></U>&#148; means at any time the Indebtedness of the Borrower and its
Subsidiaries calculated on a consolidated basis as of such time.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Consolidated Interest Expense</I></U>&#148; means, with reference to any period, the interest
expense of Borrower and its Subsidiaries calculated on a consolidated basis for such period.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Consolidated Net Income</I></U>&#148; means, with reference to any period, the net income (or
loss) of the Borrower and its Subsidiaries calculated on a consolidated basis for such period.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Consolidated Net Worth</I></U>&#148; means at any time the consolidated shareholders&#146; equity of
the Borrower and its Subsidiaries calculated on a consolidated basis as of such time.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Consolidated Tangible Net Worth</I></U>&#148; of Borrower means, at any date, Consolidated Net
Worth, less all related Intangible Assets, determined at such date. For purposes of this
definition, &#147;Intangible Assets&#148; means the amount (to the extent reflected in determining
Consolidated Net Worth) of (i)&nbsp;all write-ups in the book value of any asset owned by the Borrower
and its Subsidiaries, (ii)&nbsp;all Equity Investments of Borrower in its Subsidiaries and/or
Affiliates, and (iii)&nbsp;all unamortized debt discount and expense, unamortized deferred charges,
goodwill, patents, trademarks, service marks, trade names, anticipated future benefit of tax loss
carry-forwards, copyrights, organization or developmental expenses and other intangible assets of
Borrower and its Subsidiaries, calculated on a consolidated basis.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Contingent Obligation</I></U>&#148; of a Person means any agreement, undertaking or arrangement by
which such Person assumes, guarantees, endorses, contingently agrees to purchase or provide funds
for the payment of, or otherwise becomes or is contingently liable upon, the obligation or
liability of any other Person, or agrees to maintain the net worth or working capital or other
financial condition of any other Person, or otherwise assures any creditor of such other Person
against loss, including any comfort letter, operating agreement, take-or-pay contract or the
obligations of any such Person as general partner of a partnership with respect to the liabilities
of the partnership.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Conversion/Continuation Notice</I></U>&#148; is defined in Section&nbsp;2.7.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Controlled Group</I></U>&#148; means all members of a controlled group of corporations or other
business entities and all trades or businesses (whether or not incorporated) under common control
which, together with the Borrower or any of its Subsidiaries, are treated as a single employer
under Section&nbsp;414 of the Code.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Credit Extension</I></U>&#148; means the making of an Advance or the issuance of a Facility LC
hereunder.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Credit Extension Date</I></U>&#148; means the Borrowing Date for an Advance or the issuance date
for a Facility LC.
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Default</I></U>&#148; is defined in Article&nbsp;VII.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Dollar</I></U>&#148; and &#147;<U><I>Dollars</I></U>&#148; refer to U.S. currency.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Effective Date</I></U>&#148; means the date on which the conditions specified in Section&nbsp;4.1 are
satisfied.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Eligible Accounts Receivable</I></U>&#148; means, at any date, the portion of the Accounts
Receivable arising in the ordinary course of business from the sale of goods or services by
Borrower and its Subsidiaries that Lender determines in its sole good faith discretion, based on
credit policies, market conditions, the business of Borrower and its Subsidiaries and other
criteria, is eligible, it being understood and agreed that Lender may determine that any Accounts
Receivable are not eligible based upon the criteria set forth below and any other criteria which
Lender from time to time determines, in its reasonable discretion, is appropriate, including,
without limitation, any criteria used from time to time by Lender in such determination in
connection with credit facilities extended to any Person in a business similar or reasonably
related to that of Borrower and similarly situated. An Account Receivable shall not be deemed an
&#147;Eligible Account Receivable&#148; unless such Account Receivable is subject to a perfected first
priority security interest in favor of Administrative Agent, for the benefit of Lender, and is not
subject to any other lien, encumbrance, or security interest, is evidenced by an invoice or other
documentary evidence satisfactory to Lender, is unconditionally due and payable in Dollars to the
Borrower or a Subsidiary of Borrower from a party (the &#147;Account Debtor&#148;) and conforms to the
warranties regarding the accounts contained in this Agreement. Without limiting the generality of
the foregoing, no Account Receivable shall be an Eligible Account Receivable if:
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;the Account Receivable is due and unpaid more than 90&nbsp;days from the original invoice date;
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;the Account Receivable arises from uncompleted performance on the part of the Borrower or
any Subsidiary of Borrower, constitutes a progress billing or advance billing, is a &#147;bill and
hold,&#148; or, if involving a sale of goods, all such goods have not been lawfully shipped and invoiced
to the Account Debtor (or if requested by Lender, copies of all invoices, together with all
shipping documents and delivery receipts evidencing such shipment have not been delivered to
Lender);
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(c)&nbsp;the Account Receivable arises from a contract with any Government Authority;
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(d)&nbsp;the Account Receivable is subject to any prior assignment, claim, lien, subrogation rights
or security interest, or subject to any levy or setoff;
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(e)&nbsp;the Account Receivable is subject to any credit, contra account, allowance, adjustment,
return of goods, or discount (collectively a &#147;Contra&#148;), provided, however, that unless the Account
Debtor has asserted a Contra, if the amount of the Account Receivable exceeds the amount of the
Contra, such excess shall be considered for eligibility if such excess is not otherwise excluded
from being an Eligible Account Receivable;
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(f)&nbsp;the Account Receivable arises from an Affiliate of Borrower or any Subsidiary of Borrower;
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(g)&nbsp;the Account Receivable, when added to all other Accounts Receivable of the Account Debtor,
produces an aggregate indebtedness from the Account Debtor of more than 30% of the total of all the
Eligible Accounts Receivable;
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(h)&nbsp;the Account Debtor is subject to bankruptcy, receivership or similar proceedings or is
insolvent;
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(i)&nbsp;the Account Receivable is evidenced by any chattel paper, promissory note, payment
instrument or written agreement or arises from a consumer which is a natural person;
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(j)&nbsp;the Account Receivable arises from an Account Debtor whose mailing address or executive
office is located outside the United States;
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(k)&nbsp;the Account Receivable arises from an Account Debtor to whom goods are shipped on a &#147;cash
on delivery&#148; or C.O.D. basis;
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(l)&nbsp;the Account Receivable arises from an Account Debtor having 25% or more of its Accounts
Receivable (in Dollar value or in number of Accounts Receivable) not considered to be Eligible
Accounts Receivables;
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">the Account Receivable arises from an Account Debtor who has more than 50% of
its Accounts Receivable in Dollar value or in number of accounts with Borrower or any Subsidiary of
Borrower more than 60&nbsp;days past due; and/or
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(m)&nbsp;Lender has notified the Borrower that the Account Receivable or the Account Debtor is
unsatisfactory or unacceptable (which Lender reserves the right to do in its sole discretion at any
time).
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Eligible Inventory</I></U>&#148; means, at any date, that portion of the Inventory, determined at
such date, in which Lender has a first and exclusive perfected security interest and that Lender
determines from time to time, based on credit policies, market conditions, the business of Borrower
and the Subsidiaries and other matters, is eligible for use in calculating the Borrowing Base, it
being understood and agreed that Lender may determine that any Inventory is not eligible for use in
calculating the Borrowing Base based upon the criteria set forth below and any other criteria which
Lender from time to time determines, in its reasonable discretion, is appropriate, including,
without limitation, any criteria used from time to time by Lender in such determination in
connection with credit facilities extended to any Person in a business similar or reasonably
related to that of Borrower and similarly situated. For purposes of determining the Borrowing
Base, Eligible Inventory shall not include:
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;work in process;
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;obsolete or discontinued Inventory;
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(c)&nbsp;supply items, packaging, or the freight portion of raw materials;
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(d)&nbsp;Inventory in the control of a third person for processing, storage, or otherwise unless a
bailee&#146;s waiver or secured party of bailee&#146;s waiver, as applicable, is delivered to Lender or at
Lender&#146;s option to Administrative Agent for the benefit of Lender, in form satisfactory to Lender,
together with the original documents or other instruments evidencing such Inventory, or such other
agreements or other documents as Lender shall require in its sole and absolute discretion;
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(e)&nbsp;consigned Inventory;
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(f)&nbsp;Inventory in transit;
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(g)&nbsp;Inventory associated with any contract if the Borrower or any Subsidiary of the Borrower
has knowledge that the same may be subject to a material adverse development;
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(h)&nbsp;Inventory located outside the United States; and/or
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(i)&nbsp;Inventory associated with any contract to the extent that progress or advance payments are
received from the Account Debtor to the extent such Inventory is identified to such contract.
</DIV>
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">All Inventory shall be valued for the purposes of determining the Borrowing Base, at the lesser of
cost (on a FIFO basis) or market.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Environmental Laws</I></U>&#148; means any and all federal, state, local and foreign statutes,
laws, judicial decisions, regulations, ordinances, rules, judgments, orders, decrees, plans,
injunctions, permits, concessions, grants, franchises, licenses, agreements and other governmental
restrictions relating to (i)&nbsp;the protection of the environment, (ii)&nbsp;the effect of the environment
on human health, (iii)&nbsp;emissions, discharges or releases of pollutants, contaminants, hazardous
substances or wastes into surface water, ground water or land, or (iv)&nbsp;the manufacture, processing,
distribution, use, treatment, storage, disposal, transport or handling of pollutants, contaminants,
hazardous substances or wastes or the clean-up or other remediation thereof.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Equity Investment</I></U>&#148; of a Person means any loan, advance (other than commission, travel
and similar advances to officers and employees made in the ordinary course of business), extension
of credit (other than accounts receivable arising in the ordinary course of business on terms
customary in the trade) or contribution of capital by such Person, except to the extent any of the
foregoing constitutes, as to the Person receiving such Equity Investment, Permitted Indebtedness.
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>ERISA</I></U>&#148; means the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974, as amended from
time to time, and any rule or regulation issued thereunder.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Eurodollar Advance</I></U>&#148; means an Advance which, except as otherwise provided in Section
2.11, bears interest at the applicable Eurodollar Rate.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Eurodollar Base Rate</I></U>&#148; means, with respect to a Eurodollar Advance for the relevant
Interest Period, an interest rate per annum (based on a 360-day year) obtained by dividing (i)&nbsp;the
actual or estimated arithmetic mean of the per annum rates of interest at which deposits in U.S.
dollars, for a period of time equal to the Interest Period in effect with respect to the relevant
Loan, and in an aggregate amount comparable to the amount of the principal balance of the Loan, are
being offered to U.S. banks by one or more prime banks in the London interbank market on the second
Business Day prior to the first day of each Interest Period, as offered and determined by Lender in
accordance with its standard practices and procedures based upon reference to information which
appears on page LIBOR01 captioned &#147;British Bankers Assoc. Interest Settlement Rates&#148; of the Reuters
America Network, a service of Reuters America, Inc. (or such other page that may replace that page
on that service for the purpose of displaying London interbank offered rates), or, if such service
ceases to be available or ceases to be used by Lender, such other reasonably comparable money rate
service selected by Lender, for obtaining rate quotations, or any other reasonable procedure, all
as determined by Lender; by (ii)&nbsp;a percentage equal to 100% minus the Reserve Requirement.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Eurodollar Loan</I></U>&#148; means a Loan which, except as otherwise provided in Section&nbsp;2.11,
bears interest at the applicable Eurodollar Rate.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Eurodollar Rate</I></U>&#148; means, with respect to a Eurodollar Advance for the relevant
Interest Period, the sum of (i)&nbsp;the Eurodollar Base Rate applicable to such Interest Period,
<U>plus</U> (ii)&nbsp;the Applicable Margin.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Excluded Taxes</I></U>&#148; means, with respect to Lender or any applicable Lending Installation,
taxes imposed on its overall net income or net worth, and franchise taxes imposed on it, by (i)&nbsp;the
jurisdiction under the laws of which Lender is incorporated or organized, or (ii)&nbsp;the jurisdiction
in which Lender&#146;s principal executive office or applicable Lending Installation is located.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Exhibit</I></U>&#148; refers to an exhibit to this Agreement, unless another document is
specifically referenced.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Facility LC</I></U>&#148; is defined in Section&nbsp;2.19.1.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Facility LC Application</I></U><I>&#148; is defined in Section&nbsp;2.19.3. &#147;</I><U><I>Facility Termination
Date</I></U>&#148; means October&nbsp;15, 2008, or any earlier date on which the Aggregate Commitment is reduced
to zero or otherwise terminated pursuant to the terms hereof.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Facility Termination Date</I></U>&#148; means October&nbsp;15, 2008 or any earlier date on which the
Commitment is reduced to zero or otherwise terminated pursuant to the terms hereof.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Fast Forward</I></U>&#148; means Fast Forward Solutions, LLC, an Ohio limited liability company.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Fast Forward Guaranty</I></U>&#148; means that certain Subsidiary Guaranty, dated May&nbsp;28, 2004,
executed by Fast Forward pursuant to the First Amended and Restated Credit Agreement in favor of
Administrative Agent, for the benefit of the &#147;Lenders&#148; (as defined thereunder), which shall
continue in full force and effect for the sole benefit of Lender, as the same may be amended,
modified, supplemented, extended, restated and/or replaced from time to time.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Federal Funds Effective Rate</I></U>&#148; means, for any day, an interest rate per annum equal to
the weighted average of the rates on overnight Federal funds transactions with members of the
Federal Reserve System arranged by Federal funds brokers on such day, as published for such day
(or, if such day is not a Business Day, for the immediately preceding Business Day) by the Federal
Reserve Bank of New York, or, if such rate is not so published for any day which is a Business Day,
the average of the quotations at approximately 10:00&nbsp;a.m. (Columbus, Ohio time) on such day on such
transactions received by Lender from three Federal funds brokers of recognized standing selected by
Lender in its sole discretion.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Final Judgment</I></U>&#148; is defined in Section&nbsp;12.6(ii).
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Financial Contract</I></U>&#148; of a Person means any exchange-traded or over-the-counter
futures, forward, swap or option contract or other financial instrument with similar
characteristics, to the extent any of the same are entered into for speculative (rather than risk
management) purposes.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>First Amended and Restated Credit Agreement</I></U>&#148; means that certain Amended and Restated
Credit Agreement by and among Borrower, The Huntington National Bank, in its capacity as Agent and
as a &#147;Lender&#148; thereunder, and JPMorgan Chase Bank, N.A., a national banking association formerly
known as Bank One, N.A., as a &#147;Lender&#148; thereunder, which is amended and restated in its entirety by
this Agreement.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Fixed Assets</I></U>&#148; means, at any date, the aircraft and related tangible fixed assets of
Borrower and Guarantor which constitute Collateral under the Security Agreements and in which
Lender has a perfected security interest.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Fixed Charge Coverage Ratio</I></U>&#148; means, as of any date of calculation, the ratio of (i)
(1)&nbsp;Consolidated EBITDA, minus (2)&nbsp;the sum of (a)&nbsp;income taxes actually paid, net of any income tax
refunds received, by Borrower and its Subsidiaries on a consolidated basis, and (b)&nbsp;Maintenance
Capital Expenditures, divided by (ii) (1)&nbsp;principal and interest payments scheduled with respect to
Consolidated Indebtedness, plus (2)&nbsp;Consolidated Dividends.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Float</I></U>&#148; means Float Control, Inc., a Michigan corporation.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Floating Rate</I></U>&#148; means, for any day, a rate per annum equal to (i)&nbsp;the Alternative Base
Rate for such day <U>plus</U> (ii)&nbsp;the Applicable Margin, in each case changing when and as the
Prime Rate or the Federal Funds Effective Rate, as applicable, changes.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Floating Rate Advance</I></U>&#148; means an Advance which, except as otherwise provided in
Section&nbsp;2.11, bears interest at the Floating Rate.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Floating Rate Loan</I></U>&#148; means a Loan which, except as otherwise provided in Section&nbsp;2.11,
bears interest at the Floating Rate.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Governmental Authority</I></U>&#148; means any national government, central bank or comparable
agency, any state or other political subdivision thereof and any entity exercising executive,
legislative, judicial, regulatory or administrative functions of or pertaining to government.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Guarantor</I></U>&#148; means, separately and collectively, AMI, Float, Jetride, Timexpress and
Fast Forward, each of which is a Wholly-Owned Subsidiary of Borrower.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Guaranty</I></U>&#148; means, separately and collectively, the Subsidiary Guaranty, the Timexpress
Guaranty and the Fast Forward Guaranty.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Indebtedness</I></U>&#148; of a Person means such Person&#146;s (i)&nbsp;obligations for borrowed money,
(ii)&nbsp;obligations representing the deferred purchase price of Property or services (other than
accounts payable and accrued expenses arising in the ordinary course of such Person&#146;s business
payable on terms customary in the trade), (iii)&nbsp;obligations, whether or not assumed, secured by
Liens against, or payable out of the proceeds or production from, Property now or hereafter owned
or acquired by such Person, (iv)&nbsp;obligations which are evidenced by notes, acceptances, or other
instruments, (v)&nbsp;obligations of such Person to purchase securities or other Property arising out of
or in connection with the sale of the same or substantially similar securities or Property, (vi)
Capitalized Lease Obligations, (vii)&nbsp;Contingent Obligations, and (viii)&nbsp;any other obligation for
borrowed money which in accordance with Agreement Accounting Principles would be shown as a
liability on the consolidated balance sheet of such Person.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Interest Period</I></U>&#148; means, with respect to a Eurodollar Advance, a period of one, two,
three or six months commencing on a Business Day selected by the Borrower pursuant to this
Agreement. Such Interest Period shall end on the day which corresponds numerically to such date
one, two, three or six months thereafter, <I>provided, however, </I>that if there is no such numerically
corresponding day in such next, second, third or sixth succeeding month, such Interest Period shall
end on the last Business Day of such next, second, third or sixth succeeding month. If an Interest
Period would otherwise end on a day which is not a Business Day, such Interest Period shall end on
the next succeeding Business Day, <I>provided, however, </I>that if said next succeeding Business Day
falls in a new calendar month, such Interest Period shall end on the immediately preceding Business
Day<B>.</B>
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Inventory</I></U>&#148; shall mean at any date the total of all goods which would be properly
classified in accordance with Agreement Accounting Principles as inventory on the consolidated
balance sheet of the Borrower and its Subsidiaries at such date.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Investment</I></U>&#148; of a Person means any loan, advance (other than commission, travel and
similar advances to officers and employees made in the ordinary course of business), extension of
credit (other than accounts receivable arising in the ordinary course of business on terms
customary in the trade) or contribution of capital by such Person; stocks, bonds, mutual funds,
partnership interests, notes, debentures or other securities owned by such Person; any deposit
accounts and certificates of deposit owned by such Person which do not constitute Cash Equivalents;
and Financial Contracts, derivative financial instruments and other similar instruments or
contracts owned by such Person.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Jetride</I></U>&#148; means Jetride, Inc., an Ohio corporation, now known as 7250 STARCHECK, INC.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>LC Disbursement</I></U>&#148; means a payment made by the LC Issuer pursuant to a Facility LC.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>LC Fee</I></U>&#148; is defined in Section&nbsp;2.19.4.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>LC Obligations</I></U>&#148; means, at any time, the sum, without duplication, of (i)&nbsp;the
aggregate undrawn stated amount under all Facility LCs outstanding at such time <U>plus</U> (ii)
the aggregate unpaid amount at such time for all Reimbursement Obligations.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>LC Payment Date</I></U>&#148; is defined in Section&nbsp;2.19.5.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Lender</I></U>&#148; means The Huntington National Bank, a national banking association, and its
successors and assigns, as the sole Lender hereunder, and as the sole Lender as of the date hereof
immediately prior to the effectiveness of this Agreement, under the First Amended and Restated
Credit Agreement.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Lending Installation</I></U>&#148; means, with respect to Lender, the office, branch, subsidiary
or affiliate of Lender listed on the signature pages hereof or on a Schedule or otherwise selected
by Lender pursuant to Section&nbsp;2.17.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Letter of Credit</I></U>&#148; of a Person means a letter of credit which is issued upon the
application of such Person or upon which such Person is an account party or for which such Person
is in any way liable.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Leverage Ratio</I></U>&#148; means, as of any date of calculation, the ratio of (i)&nbsp;Consolidated
Funded Indebtedness outstanding on such date divided by (ii)&nbsp;Consolidated EBITDA for the Borrower&#146;s
then most-recently ended four fiscal quarters.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Lien</I></U>&#148; means any lien (statutory or other), mortgage, pledge, hypothecation,
assignment, deposit arrangement, encumbrance or preference, priority or other security agreement or
preferential arrangement of any kind or nature whatsoever (including the interest of a vendor or
lessor under any conditional sale, Capitalized Lease or other title retention agreement).
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Loan Documents</I></U>&#148; means this Agreement, the Security Agreements, the Pledge, the Notes,
the Subsidiary Guaranty, the Fast Forward Guaranty, the Timexpress Guaranty, the Facility LC
Applications, and any other documents and/or instruments heretofore, now or hereafter given
pursuant hereto or thereto or otherwise in connection herewith or therewith.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Loans</I></U>&#148; means the loans made by Lender to the Borrower pursuant to this Agreement (or
any conversion or continuation thereof).
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Maintenance Capital Expenditures</I></U>&#148; means capital expenditures which are capitalized by
Borrower and which maintain or extend the useful life of aircraft, exclusive of costs associated
with the purchase and installation of Required Vertical Separate Minimum modules, Global
Positioning Systems and Shadin Digital Fuel Management Systems on aircraft operated by the Borrower
or any Subsidiary.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Margin Stock</I></U>&#148; has the meaning assigned to such term in Regulation&nbsp;U.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Material Adverse Effect</I></U>&#148; means a material adverse effect on (i)&nbsp;the business,

Subsidiaries taken as a whole, (ii)&nbsp;the ability of the Borrower to perform its obligations under
the Loan Documents to which it is a party, or (iii)&nbsp;the validity or enforceability of any of the

</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Material Indebtedness</I></U>&#148; shall have the meaning set forth in Section&nbsp;7.5.

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Maximum Rate</I></U>&#148; shall have the meaning set forth in Section&nbsp;12.20.

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Moody&#146;s</I></U>&#148; means Moody&#146;s Investors Service, Inc.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Multiemployer Plan</I></U>&#148; means a Plan maintained pursuant to a collective bargaining
agreement or any other arrangement to which the Borrower or any member of the Controlled Group is a
party to which more than one employer is obligated to make contributions.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Note</I></U>&#148; or &#147;<U><I>Notes</I></U>&#148; means the promissory note given by Borrower in favor of
Lender, in the maximum principal amount of the Commitment, dated of even date herewith and in the
form of Exhibit&nbsp;A, which constitutes an amendment and restatement of, and evidence of the
indebtedness previously evidenced by that certain (i)&nbsp;Note (as amended from time to time, the &#147;HNB
Note&#148;) dated March&nbsp;24, 2005 given by Borrower in favor of Lender in the face amount of
$18,750,000.00, and (ii)&nbsp;Note (as amended from time to time, the &#147;JPM Note&#148;) dated March&nbsp;24, 2005
given by Borrower in favor of JPMorgan Chase Bank, a national banking association (&#147;JPM&#148;) formerly
known as Bank One, N.A. (Columbus), in the face amount of $11,250,000.00, each executed and
delivered by Borrower pursuant to the First Amended and Restated Credit Agreement, the maximum
outstanding principal indebtedness available under (i)&nbsp;the HNB Note being, as of the date hereof,
zero Dollars ($0), and (ii)&nbsp;the JPM Note being, as of the date hereof, zero Dollars ($0), with said
JPM Note having been assigned by JPM to Lender pursuant to the Assignment Agreement dated of even
date herewith by and between Lender and JPM, as Assignee and Assignor, respectively.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Notice of Assignment</I></U>&#148; is defined in Section&nbsp;11.3.2.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Obligations</I></U>&#148; means all unpaid principal of and accrued and unpaid interest on the
Loans, all accrued and unpaid fees, all Reimbursement Obligations, and all expenses,
reimbursements, indemnities and other obligations of the Borrower to Lender, the Administrative
Agent, or any indemnified party arising under the Loan Documents or to Lender, Administrative
Agent, or any Affiliate of any of them in connection with any Rate Management Transactions.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Off-Balance Sheet Liability</I></U>&#148; of a Person means (i)&nbsp;any repurchase obligation or
repurchase liability of such Person with respect to accounts or notes receivable sold by such
Person, (ii)&nbsp;any liability under any Sale and Leaseback Transaction which is not a Capitalized
Lease, (iii)&nbsp;any liability under any so-called &#147;synthetic lease&#148; transaction entered into by such
Person, or (iv)&nbsp;any obligation arising with respect to any other transaction which is the
functional equivalent of or takes the place of borrowing but which does not constitute a liability
on the balance sheet of such Person, but excluding from this clause (iv)&nbsp;Operating Lease
Obligations.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Operating Lease</I></U>&#148; of a Person means any lease of Property (other than a Capitalized
Lease) by such Person as lessee which has an original term (including any required renewals and any
renewals effective at the option of the lessor) of more than one year.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Operating Lease Obligations</I></U>&#148; means, as at any date of determination, the amount
obtained by aggregating the present values, determined in the case of each particular Operating
Lease by applying a discount rate (which discount rate shall equal the discount rate which would be
applied under Agreement Accounting Principles if such Operating Lease were a Capitalized Lease)
from the date on which each fixed lease payment is due under such Operating Lease to such date of
determination, of all fixed lease payments due under all Operating Leases of the Borrower and its
Subsidiaries.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Original Credit Agreement</I></U>&#148; is defined in the First Amended and Restated Credit
Agreement.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Other Taxes</I></U>&#148; is defined in Section&nbsp;3.5(ii).
</DIV>

time.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Participants</I></U>&#148; is defined in Section&nbsp;11.2.1.

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Payment Date</I></U>&#148; means the last day of March, 2007 and the last day of each third month
thereafter through the Maturity Date.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>PBGC</I></U>&#148; means the Pension Benefit Guaranty Corporation, or any successor thereto.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Person</I></U>&#148; means any natural person, corporation, firm, joint venture, partnership,
limited liability company, association, enterprise, trust or other entity or organization, or any
government or political subdivision or any agency, department or instrumentality thereof.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Plan</I></U>&#148; means an employee pension benefit plan which is covered by Title IV of ERISA or
subject to the minimum funding standards under Section&nbsp;412 of the Code as to which the Borrower or
any member of the Controlled Group may have any liability.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Pledge</I></U>&#148; means, separately and collectively, that certain Stock Pledge Agreement and
that certain Security Agreement, Pledge and Assignment of Membership Interest, each dated May&nbsp;28,
2004, given by Borrower pursuant to the First Amended and Restated Credit Agreement, in favor of
Administrative Agent (as defined thereunder), for the benefit of the &#147;Lenders&#148; (as defined
thereunder), which shall continue in full force and effect for the sole benefit of Lender, as the
same may be amended, modified, supplemented, extended, restated and/or replaced from time to time.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Pricing Schedule</I></U>&#148; means the Schedule attached hereto identified as such.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Prime Rate</I></U>&#148; means the &#147;prime rate&#148; established by Lender from time to time based on
its consideration of economic, money market, business and competitive factors, and it is not
necessarily Lender&#146;s most favored rate. In the event Lender shall abolish or abandon the practice
of establishing its Prime Rate or should the same be unascertainable, Lender shall designate a
comparable reference rate which shall be deemed to be the Prime Rate under this Agreement and the
other Loan Documents.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Property</I></U>&#148; of a Person means any and all property, whether real, personal, tangible,
intangible, or mixed, of such Person, or other assets owned or leased.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Purchasers</I></U>&#148; is defined in Section&nbsp;11.3.1.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Rate Management Transaction</I></U>&#148; means any transaction (including an agreement with
respect thereto) now existing or hereafter entered into between the Borrower and Lender or any
Affiliate of Lender which is a rate swap, basis swap, forward rate transaction, commodity swap,
commodity option, equity or equity index swap, equity or equity index option, bond option, interest
rate option, foreign exchange transaction, cap transaction, floor transaction, collar transaction,
forward transaction, currency swap transaction, cross-currency rate swap transaction, currency
option or any other similar transaction (including any option with respect to any of these
transactions) or any combination thereof, whether linked to one or more interest rates, foreign
currencies, commodity prices, equity prices or other financial measures.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Rate Management Obligations</I></U>&#148; of a Person means any and all obligations of such
Person, whether absolute or contingent and howsoever and whenever created, arising, evidenced or
acquired (including all renewals, extensions and modifications thereof and substitutions therefor),
under (i)&nbsp;any and all Rate Management Transactions, and (ii)&nbsp;any and all cancellations, buy backs,
reversals, terminations or assignments of any Rate Management Transactions.

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Regulation&nbsp;D</I></U>&#148; means Regulation&nbsp;D of the Board as from time to time in effect and any
successor thereto or other regulation or official interpretation of the Board relating to reserve
requirements applicable to member banks of the Federal Reserve System.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Regulation&nbsp;T</I></U>&#148; means Regulation&nbsp;T of the Board as from time to time in effect and all
official rulings and interpretations thereunder or thereof.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Regulation&nbsp;U</I></U>&#148; means Regulation&nbsp;U of the Board as from time to time in effect and any
successor or other regulation or official interpretation of the Board relating to the extension of
credit by banks for the
purpose of purchasing or carrying margin stocks applicable to member banks of the Federal Reserve
System.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Regulation&nbsp;X</I></U>&#148; means Regulation&nbsp;X of the Board as from time to time in effect and all
official rulings and interpretations thereunder or thereof.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Reimbursement Obligations</I></U>&#148; means, at any time, the aggregate of all obligations of
the Borrower then outstanding under Section&nbsp;2.19 to reimburse Lender for amounts paid by Lender in
respect of any one or more drawings under Facility LCs.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Reportable Event</I></U>&#148; means a reportable event as defined in Section&nbsp;4043 of ERISA and
the regulations issued under such section, with respect to a Plan, excluding, however, such events
as to which the PBGC has by regulation waived the requirement of Section 4043(a) of ERISA that it
be notified within 30&nbsp;days of the occurrence of such event, <I>provided, however, </I>that a failure to
meet the minimum funding standard of Section&nbsp;412 of the Code and of Section&nbsp;302 of ERISA shall be a
Reportable Event regardless of the issuance of any such waiver of the notice requirement in
accordance with either Section 4043(a) of ERISA or Section 412(d) of the Code.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Reports</I></U>&#148; has the meaning set forth in Section&nbsp;12.6.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Required Property Insurance Coverage</I></U>&#148; means at any time insurance insuring all
Property of the Borrower and its Subsidiaries against loss or damage by fire, lightning, vandalism
and malicious mischief and all other perils covered by standard &#147;extended coverage&#148; or &#147;all-risk&#148;
insurance and such other risks and losses as is consistent with sound business practices and is
customarily maintained from time to time by similar businesses similarly situated and owning,
leasing or operating similar properties, including, without limitation, war and terrorism coverage
with respect to all jet aircraft; all in such amounts, and having such deductibles from the loss
payable for any casualty, as is customary from time to time for similar businesses similarly
situated and owning, leasing or operating similar properties. If any insurance policies with
respect to Required Property Insurance Coverage is written on a co-insurance basis, such policy
must contain an agreed amount endorsement as evidence that the coverage is in an amount sufficient
to insure the full amount of such Property.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Required Public Liability Insurance Coverage</I></U>&#148; means comprehensive general accident
and public liability insurance (including, without limitation, coverage for product liability, and
elevators and escalators, if any, on property owned or leased by the Borrower and its Subsidiaries)
against injury, loss and/or damage to persons and property and such other risks and losses as is
consistent with sound business practices and is customarily maintained from time to time by similar
businesses similarly situated and owning, leasing or operating similar properties; all in such
amounts as is customary from time to time for similar businesses similarly situated and owning,
leasing or operating similar properties.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Reserve Requirement</I></U>&#148; means, with respect to an Interest Period, the maximum aggregate
reserve requirement (including all basic, supplemental, marginal and other reserves) which is
imposed under Regulation&nbsp;D on Eurocurrency liabilities.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Revolving Commitment</I></U>&#148; and &#147;<U><I>Commitment</I></U>&#148; each mean the obligation of Lender to
make Revolving Loans to Borrower in an aggregate amount not exceeding Fifteen Million Dollars
$15,000,000.00), as such amount may be modified from time to time pursuant to the terms hereof.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Revolving Loan</I></U>&#148; and &#147;<U><I>Revolving Loans</I></U>&#148; means a Loan or the Loans,
respectively, made pursuant to clause (b)&nbsp;of Section&nbsp;2.1.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>S&#038;P</I></U>&#148; means Standard and Poor&#146;s Ratings Services, a division of The McGraw Hill
Companies, Inc.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Sale and Leaseback Transaction</I></U>&#148; means any sale or other transfer of Property by any
Person with the intent to lease such Property as lessee.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Schedule</I></U>&#148; refers to a specific schedule to this Agreement, unless another document is
specifically referenced.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U><I>Section</I></U>&#148; means a numbered section of this Agreement, unless another document is
specifically referenced.
</DIV>
